contextId.occurrenceNote: This emphasizes the great number of Israelites. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like the sand of the seashore

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh will change Israel to resemble the wilderness, which is a region that is bare and unproductive. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: I will make her like the wilderness

contextId.occurrenceNote: Israel is compared to a young cow that will not obey its master. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like a stubborn heifer

contextId.occurrenceNote: Ephraim is presented in terms of a prostitute because the people have become unfaithful to God, as a prostitute is faithful to no man. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: Ephraim, now you have become like a prostitute

contextId.occurrenceNote: To "move a boundary stone" refers to moving the landmark that marked the border of some property, which was a crime under Israelite law. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: The leaders of Judah are like those who move a boundary stone

contextId.occurrenceNote: A moth on a piece of wool and rot in a piece of wood are both destructive. Yahweh will destroy both nations. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: I will be like a moth to Ephraim, and like rot to the house of Judah

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh is going to pursue and attack Ephraim like a lion. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: So I will be like a lion to Ephraim

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh is going to treat Judah in a similar way. Yahweh is showing his displeasure with both the northern and the southern kingdoms. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like a young lion to the house of Judah

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh will come to help his people just as surely as the sun rises each morning. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: His coming out is as sure as the dawn

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the prophet Hosea is speaking to God. He may mean that when God gives the command for someone to die as punishment, it is like a bolt of lightning that strikes. Or he may mean that God's commandments allow people to know the truth, just as light makes objects visible. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: Your decrees are like the light that shines out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. This means the people had strong desires to do evil. Alternate translation: "like an oven which the baker heats" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: like an oven heated by the baker

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means like a fire burns in an oven, these people have strong evil desires within them. The people's desires are represented by their "hearts." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: For with hearts like an oven

contextId.occurrenceNote: The intensity of their anger is spoken of as if it was a very hot fire. Alternate translation: "it gets very intense" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: it burns high like a flaming fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This compares their anger to the heat that comes from an oven. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: They all are as hot as an oven

contextId.occurrenceNote: Doves were thought to be foolish birds. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: Ephraim is like a dove, gullible and without sense

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh speaks of the way he will judge Israel as if they were birds that he would catch in a net. Alternate translation: "I will hunt them like birds" or "I will catch them like a hunter catches birds" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: I will bring them down like the birds of the sky

contextId.occurrenceNote: That is, a bow that has no bowstring, or that has no tension. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: They are like a slack bow

contextId.occurrenceNote: People often think of donkeys as being stubborn. This means the people of Israel refused to listen to Yahweh but instead went to the people of Assyria for help. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like a wild donkey all alone

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "mourners' food" refers to what people would eat while they mourning because they were defiled and not acceptable to God. This means Yahweh will consider the people's sacrifices to be defiled and he will not accept them. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: Their sacrifices will be to them like mourners' food

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people of Ephraim, or the northern kingdom of Israel, will lose everything that makes other nations respect them. Their glory will quickly disappear, as a bird flies away. Alternate translation: "their glory will be like a bird that flies away from them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: their glory will fly away like a bird

contextId.occurrenceNote: Their lies and injustice spread throughout their nation and harm everyone like poisonous plants. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like poisonous weeds in the furrows of a field

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means the king of Samaria will be as helpless as a small piece of wood that waves of the water toss back and forth. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like a chip of wood on the surface of the water

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh is speaking of the nation of Israel as a hardworking animal whose work he made easier. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: I was to them like someone who eased the yoke on their jaws

contextId.occurrenceNote: Yahweh making it possible for his people to return to his land is spoken of as if he were calling to his people. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: he will roar like a lion

contextId.occurrenceNote: They will come home quickly as a bird returns to its nest. "Trembling" may refer to the fluttering of a bird's wings. It may also signal the people's feelings of humility and reverence for God (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: They will come trembling like a bird ... like a dove

contextId.occurrenceNote: The altars where the people worshiped will be thrown down and become piles of stones. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: their altars will be like heaps of stone in the furrows of the fields

contextId.occurrenceNote: These expressions state that Israel is temporary and will soon disappear if they continue to worship idols instead of following Yahweh. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: So they will be like the morning clouds ... like the dew ... like the chaff ... like smoke out of a chimney

contextId.occurrenceNote: These are wild animals that attack and kill other animals. Yahweh continues to say that he will destroy his people for their sins. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like a lion ... like a leopard

contextId.occurrenceNote: These are wild animals that attack and kill other animals. Yahweh continues to say that he will destroy his people for their sins. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: as a bear ... as a lion ... as a wild beast

contextId.occurrenceNote: God is spoken of as if he were dew that brought needed moisture to plants, and Israel is spoken of as if it were one person, and as if he were a flower that could blossom. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: I will be like the dew to Israel; he will blossom like the lily

contextId.occurrenceNote: The picture of Israel in the form of a plant is continued here, but this time in the form of a tall cedar tree in Lebanon, which was known for such trees. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: take root like a cedar in Lebanon

contextId.occurrenceNote: This passage continues the same image. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: His branches will spread out ... like the cedars in Lebanon

contextId.occurrenceNote: Israel's new prosperity is spoken of in agricultural terms. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: they will revive like grain and blossom like vines

contextId.occurrenceNote: Just as Lebanon's wine was famous, so Israel will be famous. Alternate translation: "People everywhere will know about the nation of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: His fame will be like the wine of Lebanon

contextId.occurrenceNote: A cypress is a tree whose leaves stay green all year. This represents Yahweh and his blessings on Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: a cypress whose leaves are always green
